title: Requirements Gathering for Neural Cryptography System
description: Define the system's functional and non-functional requirements based on the project description and user needs. Include security, performance, scalability, and user experience considerations.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Develop a high-level design for the NeuralCryptographySystem, including components like neural network models, encryption/decryption algorithms, and system interfaces.

title: Develop Neural Network Models
description: Create and train neural network models capable of identifying unique brain patterns for encryption/decryption purposes. This task involves selecting appropriate algorithms, training the models with real-world data, and optimizing them for efficiency.

title: Implement Encryption/Decryption Algorithms
description: Write the code for the encryption and decryption algorithms based on the neural network models.

title: Design User Interface
description: Create an intuitive and user-friendly interface for the NeuralCryptographySystem.

title: Develop Database Schema
description: Define the structure and relationships of the database required for storing user data, brain pattern information, and any necessary metadata. The design should consider scalability, performance, and security.

title: Implement Database Scheme
description: Develop the database based on the defined schema.

title: Integration and Testing
description: Combine the developed components and test the overall system functionality.

title: Security Review
description: Evaluate the system's security measures and ensure that the NeuralCryptographySystem is secure enough for user data protection.

title: Documentation
description: Write clear, concise, and comprehensive documentation for the NeuralCryptographySystem. This includes user guides, API references, and internal development documentation. Ensure that the documentation is easily accessible, searchable, and understandable by various levels of users (developers, system administrators, and end-users).
